name: Senegal
description: Senegal, a West African nation, boasts a diverse landscape ranging from the vast Sahelian grasslands to the Atlantic coastline. Known for its vibrant culture, rich history, and significant role in the slave trade, Senegal offers a unique blend of traditional and modern influences. It’s a country of contrasts, experiencing both arid desert conditions and fertile river valleys, supporting a remarkable array of wildlife and ecosystems.

quickFacts.label: Capital
quickFacts.description: The bustling economic and political heart of Senegal.
quickFacts.detail: Dakar is a port city with a rich colonial history and a vibrant arts scene.

quickFacts.label: Population
quickFacts.description: Senegal's population is predominantly young and growing.
quickFacts.detail: The majority of the population lives in rural areas, engaged in agriculture.

quickFacts.label: Official Language
quickFacts.description: French is the official language, alongside Wolof.
quickFacts.detail: Wolof is the most widely spoken indigenous language.

quickFacts.label: Area
quickFacts.description: Senegal is a relatively small country in West Africa.
quickFacts.detail: It borders Mauritania to the north and Mali to the landward south.

quickFacts.label: GDP
quickFacts.description: Senegal's economy is largely based on agriculture and fishing.

climateData.title: Climate of Senegal
climateData.description: Senegal experiences a tropical savanna climate, characterized by distinct wet and dry seasons. The coastal areas enjoy a more moderate climate due to the influence of the Atlantic Ocean.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Dry Season (November - April)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: This is the hottest and driest period of the year, with temperatures often exceeding 35°C (95°F).

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Wet Season (May - October)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: The wet season brings increased rainfall, particularly in the inland areas. Temperatures are generally cooler.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Harmattan Winds
seasonalCharacteristics.description: A dry, dusty wind blows in from the Sahara Desert, bringing cooler temperatures and reduced visibility.

naturalWonders.name: Djoudjar National Bird Sanctuary
naturalWonders.description: Djoudjar is one of the most important wetland areas in Africa and a UNESCO World Heritage Site. It’s a haven for migratory birds, particularly during the spring and autumn.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The sanctuary covers a vast area of interconnected lagoons and marshes, providing crucial habitat for a diverse range of bird species, including flamingos, pelicans, and herons. The surrounding area offers opportunities for birdwatching and experiencing the beauty of the Senegalese wetlands.

naturalWonders.name: Sine Salax National Park
naturalWonders.description: This park encompasses a vast expanse of savanna, riverine forests, and wetlands, offering a glimpse into Senegal’s diverse ecosystems.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: Sine Salax is known for its rich biodiversity, including elephants, giraffes, antelopes, and a variety of bird species. The park’s location along the Senegal River provides crucial habitat for migratory birds and supports a thriving ecosystem.

naturalWonders.name: Île de Gorée
naturalWonders.description: A UNESCO World Heritage Site, Île de Gorée is a small island off the coast of Senegal, steeped in history as a major departure point for enslaved Africans.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The island’s architecture reflects its colonial past, with well-preserved buildings showcasing European influences. It serves as a poignant reminder of the transatlantic slave trade and a symbol of resilience and remembrance. Visitors can explore the island’s museums, churches, and historic houses.
viewingTips: Allow at least 3-4 hours to explore
Visit the House of Slaves museum

biodiversityCategory.name: Birds
biodiversityCategory.description: Senegal is a crucial stopover point for numerous migratory bird species, making it a vital region for avian biodiversity.

statistics.details: Djoudjar National Bird Sanctuary hosts a significant portion of these migratory birds.
Several bird species are found only in Senegal and surrounding regions.

notableSpecies.name: Senegal Parrot
notableSpecies.significance: A distinctive parrot species found in the Sahel region of Senegal.

notableSpecies.name: Pink-backed Pelican
notableSpecies.significance: A large pelican species that breeds in Senegal's wetlands.

ecosystemData.title: Ecosystems of Senegal
ecosystemData.overview: Senegal’s ecosystems are incredibly diverse, ranging from the arid Sahel to the humid coastal zones. These ecosystems support a rich array of plant and animal life, playing a crucial role in the country’s biodiversity and economy.

biodiversityCategories.name: Birds
biodiversityCategories.description: As discussed above, Senegal is a critical region for migratory birds and endemic species.

biodiversityCategories.name: Mammals
biodiversityCategories.description: Senegal’s mammal fauna includes elephants, giraffes, antelopes, and various carnivores.

statistics.details: Elephants and giraffes are particularly abundant in the inland savanna.

notableSpecies.name: African Elephant
notableSpecies.significance: A keystone species in the savanna ecosystem.

activities.title: Activities in Senegal
activities.description: Senegal offers a wide range of activities for travelers, from wildlife viewing and cultural experiences to water sports and adventure tourism.

activityCategories.name: Hiking
activityCategories.description: Explore Senegal’s diverse landscapes on foot, from savanna trails to coastal paths.

activities.name: Lac Rose Hiking
activities.description: A gentle hike around the pink lake, offering stunning views and opportunities for birdwatching.

activities.name: Sine Salax National Park Trek
activities.description: A guided trek through the Sine Salax National Park, exploring the savanna and riverine forests.

activityCategories.name: Water Sports
activityCategories.description: Enjoy the Atlantic coastline with a variety of water sports activities.

activities.name: Surfing at Joal
activities.description: Learn to surf at the popular surfing spot of Joal, known for its consistent waves.

activities.name: Dakar Boat Trip
activities.description: Explore the Dakar coastline by boat, visiting islands and enjoying the marine scenery.

clothing.summer: Lightweight cotton clothing, swimwear, sunscreen, hat
clothing.winter: Layers of clothing, including a jacket, sweater, and long pants
